best_gem_comment: i loved this class but that's because I'm really into history/macro. i know it seems like a gem, but the assignments are actually pretty hard. like kotz does a really good job of making you think about counterarguments and both him and Sebastian are always super available to help. despite being a 9 am, i loved going to class bc it just felt like listening to a podcast. the grading isn't the easiest but it's super fair. overall, highly recommend!
best_gem_comment_short: i know it seems like a gem, but the assignments are actually pretty hard.

best_gem_comment: This course completely transformed the way I view my economics education at Harvard. I learned how think freely, challenge mainstream economic doctrine I previously held as gospel, and for lack of of better way of explaining it, I feel like a real economist now. Professor Marglin is an absolute gem of a human being and very well may be the best professor at this school. Enjoy his hand–picked apples and go raise some Cain!
best_gem_comment_short: Professor Marglin is an absolute gem of a human being and very well may be the best professor at this school.

useful_title: A Libertarian Perspective on Economic and Social Policy
best_gem_comment: This class is very manageable and actually thought–provoking. Miron's goal isn't to brainwash you but rather show you how Libertatrian's approach policy and you can agree or disagree with whichever take you like. Entire grade is based on midterm/final so caution with that, but overall definitely a gem and worth taking.
best_gem_comment_short: Entire grade is based on midterm/final so caution with that, but overall definitely a gem and worth taking.

best_gem_comment: If you are interested in banking, take this. Super easy way to understand a lot of the work you will do in banking at a very high–level. Should be very easy to anyone interested in finance. Definite gem.

It's honestly a gem if you have good computational thinking skills and want to learn a bit more about how the world works through the lens of economic models! There are so many people in class, so you'll definitely have friends you can talk to and work with. There's definitely a mix of levels of interest in econ in this class –– from concentrators to people taking it for fun –– but you will find your psetters and learn a lot along the way!
best_gem_comment_short: It's honestly a gem if you have good computational thinking skills and want to learn a bit more about how the world works through the lens of economic models!
